item.title: Genius Leftover Cranberry Sauce Hack: Orange Cake
item.description: Transform your leftover cranberry sauce into a delightful orange cake that bursts with flavor and moisture. This cake is not only a clever way to use up leftovers but also a delicious treat that will impress your family and friends. | â±ï¸ Prep: 15min | Cook: 30min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230294638 #mediumrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: 45 minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 8

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Medium

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup leftover cranberry sauce
  • 1/2 cup orange juice
  • 1/2 cup vegetable oil
  • 2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 cup sugar
  • 2 teaspoons baking powder
  • 1/2 teaspoon salt
  • 3 large eggs
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • Zest of 1 orange

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and grease a 9-inch round cake pan.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the cranberry sauce, orange juice, and vegetable oil until well combined.
  3. Add the sugar, eggs, and vanilla extract to the mixture and beat until smooth.
  4. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, and orange zest.
  5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined.
  6. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top.
  7. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
  8. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 2 cups all-purpose flour

  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 large egg
  • 1 tablespoon red food coloring
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/2 cup powdered sugar for rolling

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
